subject: AI
title: GPT Family
description: OpenAI's model lineup from GPT-3 to GPT-4o.

hook.text: GPT-3.5 Turbo, GPT-4, GPT-4 Turbo, GPT-4o, GPT-4o mini ‚Äî OpenAI has so many models that even their own docs are confusing. Here's the map.

buildup.text: GPT-3.5 Turbo: cheap, fast, good for simple tasks. GPT-4: the reasoning powerhouse, expensive. GPT-4 Turbo: faster GPT-4 with a larger context window. GPT-4o: multimodal, faster, cheaper than GPT-4.

discovery.text: GPT-4o mini is the sweet spot for most production workloads: it's dramatically cheaper than GPT-4, fast, and handles classification, extraction, and simple reasoning well.

twist.text: OpenAI deprecates models regularly. GPT-3.5 Turbo will eventually be retired. Build for model portability ‚Äî don't hard-code to a specific model version.

climax.text: Route by task: mini for simple tasks, full GPT-4o for complex reasoning. Your cost drops 80% and quality barely changes.

punchline.text: Not every task deserves GPT-4. Most don't.

quiz.question: What's a good default strategy for using OpenAI models?
options: Route simple tasks to cheaper models and complex tasks to powerful ones
Only use GPT-3.5 to save money
Wait for GPT-5 before building anything
